{"step_by_step_thinking": "The video shows a neonate on oxygen with nasal prongs, which indicates the baby is having difficulty breathing on its own. A tube is being inserted through the mouth, and the camera zooms in to show the 18 calibration mark, which is typically used to measure the depth of insertion. The other end of the tube is not connected to anything, which suggests that it is not being used for suction. This rules out options A and B.
